verdict.summary: Pod references a ConfigMap that doesn't exist in the same namespace.

dead_ends.action: Creating an empty ConfigMap to satisfy the reference
dead_ends.why_fails: Pod starts but gets empty config; may crash on missing keys

dead_ends.action: Making the ConfigMap reference optional without checking implications
dead_ends.why_fails: optional: true means the pod starts without the config — may misbehave silently

workarounds.action: Create the ConfigMap: kubectl create configmap my-config --from-file=config.yaml
workarounds.how: Create before deploying the pod that references it

workarounds.action: Check the namespace: ConfigMaps are namespace-scoped — kubectl get configmap -n <namespace>
workarounds.how: The ConfigMap and Pod must be in the same namespace
